abstract: What are the odds that 2010 will be as benign as last year for the world’s economies? In his latest column, Thomas Friedman writes that the odds are low, and wonders whether the struggle between banks and President Obama has a win-win resolution.
snippet: What are the odds that 2010 will be as benign as last year for the world’s economies? In his latest column, Thomas Friedman writes that the odds are low, and wonders whether the struggle between banks and President Obama has a win-win resolution.
lead_paragraph: One of the few pleasant surprises of 2009 was that the world’s biggest economies were able to concentrate on healing themselves without any major wars or world-shaking political or geopolitical disruptions, Thomas Friedman writes in The New York Times. What are the odds that 2010 will be so benign?
